Content: Arrangements have been made to hold a protest tomorrow at Maradana demanding a general election. This was also revealed during a media briefing at the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna main office on the Nelum Mawatha, Battaramulla. Chairman of All Island Local Government Forum Udeni Atukorala said that local government elections were postponed for about 3 Â½ years by the government of Mr. Wickremasinghe. He said that after many struggles they were able to have the Local Government Election on the 10th of February and Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna was able to score a significant victory. He said that they have organized to conduct a protest to demand a general election. He further said that they hope to setup a strong government led by Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa to provide benefits to the people.
